subject: Sales
title: When to Bluff
description: A micro-lesson that makes When to Bluff usable.

hook.text: A poker player goes all-in with a weak hand. The table folds. Bluffing works until it doesn't.

buildup.text: A negotiation bluff is a claim you can't back up. A fake walkaway. A deadline that isn't real.

discovery.text: Bluffs succeed when the other side can't verify your claim and the stakes justify the risk.

twist.text: A called bluff is devastating. Credibility vanishes and every future claim gets questioned.

climax.text: Bluff only when the upside is huge and the risk of exposure is low. Never bluff with repeat partners.

punchline.text: A bluff wins once. Credibility wins forever.

quiz.question: When is bluffing most dangerous?
options: With people you'll negotiate with again
